content.eamr: ( ing-0 "1 cup butterscotch chips" )
( ing-1 "1 cup butter (no substitutes), softened" )
( ing-2 "1/2 cup sugar" )
( ing-3 "1/2 cup packed brown sugar" )
( ing-4 "1 egg" )
( ing-5 "2 tablespoons milk" )
( ing-6 "2 teaspoons vanilla extract" )
( ing-7 "3 cups all-purpose flour" )
( ing-8 "3/4 cup shortening" )
( ing-9 "1/4 cup water" )
( ing-10 "2 tablespoons all-purpose flour" )
( ing-11 "1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract" )
( ing-12 "4 cups confectioners' sugar" )
( ing-13 "Paste food coloring" )

content.text: 0) In a microwave, melt butterscotch chips; cool for 10 minutes.
1) In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugars.
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
   :inform ( "cream"@21:26 / AC
      :loc ( "a mixing bowl"@6:19 / TOOL )
      :ppt ( ing-1 "butter"@27:33 / FOOD )
      :ppt ( "sugars"@38:44 / FOOD 
	:ref ing-2
	:ref ing-3 )
   )
)

content.text: 2) Add egg, milk and vanilla; mix well.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
   :inform ( "Add"@3:6 / AC
      :ppt ( ing-4 "egg"@7:10 / FOOD )
      :ppt ( ing-5 "milk"@12:16 / FOOD )
      :ppt ( ing-6 "vanilla"@21:28 / FOOD )
      :ppt( NULL / FOOD )
   )
   :inform ( "mix"@30:33 / AC
      :ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
   )
)

content.text: 6) On a floured surface, roll out dough to 1/4-in. thickness.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
	:inform ( ac-6-0 "roll out"@25:33 / AC
		:loc ( tool-6-0 "a floured surface"@6:23 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( "dough"@34:39 / FOOD )
		:reshape ( "1/4-in. thickness"@43:60 / OTHER )
	)
)

content.text: 7) Cut with a floured 4-1/2-in. gingerbread man cookie cutter and a 3-in. round cutter.
content.eamr:
( inst-7 / R
	:inform ( ac-7-0 "Cut"@3:6 / AC
		:instrument ( tool-7-0 "a floured 4-1/2-in. gingerbread man cookie cutter"@12:61 / TOOL )
		:instrument ( tool-7-1 "a 3-in. round cutter"@66:86 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 8) Place 2 in. apart on greased baking sheets.
9) Bake at 375 degrees F for 5-8 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.
content.eamr:
( inst-9 / R
	:inform ( ac-9-0 "Bake"@4:8 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:heat ( temp-9-0 "375 degrees F"@12:25 / TEMPERATURE )
		:duration ( dur-9-0 "5-8 minutes"@30:41 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-9-0 "until edges are lightly browned"@45:76 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 10) Cool for 1 minute; remove to wire racks to cool completely.
content.eamr:
( inst-10 / R
	:inform ( ac-10-0 "Cool"@4:8 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:duration ( dur-10-0 "1 minute"@13:21 / DUR )
	)
	:inform ( ac-10-1 "remove"@23:29 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:gol ( tool-10-0 "wire racks"@33:43 / TOOL )
		:prp ( purp-10-0 "to cool completely"@44:62 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 11) For frosting, combine shortening, water, flour and vanilla in a mixing bowl; mix well.
content.eamr:
( inst-11 / R
	:inform ( ac-11-0 "combine"@18:25 / AC
		:subtask ( purp-11-0 "For frosting"@4:16 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( ing-8 "shortening"@26:36 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-9 "water"@38:43 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-10 "flour"@45:50 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-11 "vanilla"@55:62 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-11-0 "a mixing bowl"@66:79 / TOOL )
	)
	:inform ( ac-11-1 "mix"@81:84 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 13) Place 1 cup frosting in a plastic bag; cut a small hole in corner of bag.
14) Pipe shirt and shorts on players.
15) Fill in outline and smooth with a metal spatula.
16) Tint 1/4 cup frosting black; place in a plastic bag.
17) Pipe lines on round cookies to create basketballs; pipe hair, eyes and noses on players.
18) Tint 1/4 cup frosting red; pipe a mouth on each player.
19) Tint remaining frosting to match team colors of your choice; pipe around shirts and shorts and add a letter on shirts if desired.
